intro: Muscari neglectum var. atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic grape hyacinth, is a bulbous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale blue to violet, resembling grapes, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with strap-like, grassy foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often naturalizing in gardens over time. This variety is prized for its early spring bloom and low maintenance requirements.
